intro: Sisyrinchium laetum, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to arid conditions. Sisyrinchium laetum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
